channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Fractal Generative Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new level of modularization by abstracting generative models into atomic generative modules.

item.title: From System 1 to System 2: A Survey of Reasoning Large Language Models
item.description: Achieving human-level intelligence requires refining the transition from the fast, intuitive System 1 to the slower, more deliberate System 2 reasoning.

item.title: Magma: A Foundation Model for Multimodal AI Agents
item.description: We present Magma, a foundation model that serves multimodal AI agentic tasks in both the digital and physical worlds.

item.title: Merlion: A Machine Learning Library for Time Series
item.description: We introduce Merlion, an open-source machine learning library for time series.

item.title: Distill Any Depth: Distillation Creates a Stronger Monocular Depth Estimator
item.description: In this paper, we systematically analyze the impact of different depth normalization strategies on pseudo-label distillation.

item.title: R1-OnevisionAn Open-Source Multimodal Large Language Model Capable of Deep Reasoning
item.description: R1-OneVision is a versatile multimodal reasoning large model, designed to tackle complex visual reasoning tasks.

item.title: HybridFlow: A Flexible and Efficient RLHF Framework
item.description: Traditional RL can be modeled as a dataflow, where each node represents computation of a neural network (NN) and each edge denotes data dependencies between the NNs.

item.title: Training AI to be Loyal
item.description: The key scientific question then is: how can we build models that are openly accessible (open source) and yet are owned and governed by the community.

item.title: PIKE-RAG: sPecIalized KnowledgE and Rationale Augmented Generation
item.description: Despite notable advancements in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems that expand large language model (LLM) capabilities through external retrieval, these systems often struggle to meet the complex and diverse needs of real-world industrial applications.

item.title: Free-Form Image Inpainting with Gated Convolution
item.description: We present a generative image inpainting system to complete images with free-form mask and guidance.

item.title: Revisiting Adversarial Training under Long-Tailed Distributions
item.description: Extensive experiments further corroborate that data augmentation alone can significantly improve robustness.

item.title: Atom of Thoughts for Markov LLM Test-Time Scaling
item.description: Based on this observation, we propose Atom of Thoughts (AoT), where each state transition in the reasoning process consists of decomposing the current question into a dependency-based directed acyclic graph and contracting its subquestions, forming a new atomic question state.

item.title: EliGen: Entity-Level Controlled Image Generation with Regional Attention
item.description: Recent advancements in diffusion models have significantly advanced text-to-image generation, yet global text prompts alone remain insufficient for achieving fine-grained control over individual entities within an image.

item.title: DICEPTION: A Generalist Diffusion Model for Visual Perceptual Tasks
item.description: We achieve results on par with SAM-vit-h using only 0. 06% of their data (e. g., 600K vs. 1B pixel-level annotated images).

item.title: Step-Audio: Unified Understanding and Generation in Intelligent Speech Interaction
item.description: Based on our new StepEval-Audio-360 evaluation benchmark, Step-Audio achieves state-of-the-art performance in human evaluations, especially in terms of instruction following.

item.title: IndexTTS: An Industrial-Level Controllable and Efficient Zero-Shot Text-To-Speech System
item.description: Recently, large language model (LLM) based text-to-speech (TTS) systems have gradually become the mainstream in the industry due to their high naturalness and powerful zero-shot voice cloning capabilities. Here, we introduce the IndexTTS system, which is mainly based on the XTTS and Tortoise model.

item.title: PhotoDoodle: Learning Artistic Image Editing from Few-Shot Pairwise Data
item.description: Subsequently, we fine-tune this model with EditLoRA using a small, artist-curated dataset of before-and-after image pairs to capture distinct editing styles and techniques.

item.title: Audio-FLAN: A Preliminary Release
item.description: Audio-FLAN lays the foundation for unified audio-language models that can seamlessly handle both understanding (e. g., transcription, comprehension) and generation (e. g., speech, music, sound) tasks across a wide range of audio domains in a zero-shot manner.

item.title: Hawk: Learning to Understand Open-World Video Anomalies
item.description: Video Anomaly Detection (VAD) systems can autonomously monitor and identify disturbances, reducing the need for manual labor and associated costs.

item.title: Baichuan-Audio: A Unified Framework for End-to-End Speech Interaction
item.description: To mitigate the loss of intelligence during pre-training and preserve the original capabilities of the LLM, we propose a two-stage pre-training strategy that maintains language understanding while enhancing audio modeling.
